metadata.title: Comprehensive Assessment Plan for OpenShift 4 - ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 SL-1 through SL-4

control-selections.description: All applicable controls for an SL-4 baseline for OpenShift 4, covering SL-1 through SL-4.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.1 & RE(1,2): Human User Identification, Uniqueness, and MFA
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the integration with an external Identity Provider (IdP) to enforce unique, multi-factor authentication for all human users.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the `OAuth` cluster resource configuration to verify integration with the documented external IdP.
**Interview:** Interview the IdP administrator to confirm that MFA policies are enforced and that user identifiers are unique across the organization.
**Test:** Attempt to log in with a test user. Verify redirection to the IdP and the presentation of an MFA challenge.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.2 & RE(1): Software Process and Device Identification
assessment-activities.description: Assesses how software processes (pods and system components) are uniquely identified.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `oc get serviceaccount --all-namespaces` to list all ServiceAccounts. For a sample application, inspect the pod definition (`oc get pod <name> -o yaml`) to verify it uses a unique, non-default ServiceAccount.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.3: Account Management
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the procedures for managing the lifecycle of user accounts via the IdP.

steps.description: **Interview:** Interview the IdP administrator to review the documented procedures for user account creation, modification, disabling, and deletion.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.5 & RE(1): Authenticator Management and Hardware Security
assessment-activities.description: Assesses how authenticators (e.g., etcd encryption keys) are managed and protected.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the `APIServer` cluster resource (`oc get apiserver cluster -o yaml`) to verify that `.spec.encryption.type` is set to `aescbc` or a stronger algorithm.
**Interview:** Interview the infrastructure security team to review the architecture and configuration of the Hardware Security Module (HSM) used for etcd key encryption.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.7 & RE(1,2): Strength of Password-based Authentication
assessment-activities.description: Assesses password policies enforced by the external IdP.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review the password policy configuration in the external IdP to confirm it enforces minimum length, complexity, history, and lifetime restrictions for all user types.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-1.12: System Use Notification
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the configuration of the login banner.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `oc get oauth cluster -o yaml` and inspect the `.spec.templates.login` section to verify it contains the approved system use notification text.
**Test:** Navigate to the OpenShift web console login page and visually confirm the banner is displayed.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-2.1 & RE(1,2,3,4): Authorization and Dual Approval
assessment-activities.description: Assesses RBAC, least privilege, and the procedural dual-approval workflow.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review `RoleBinding` and `ClusterRoleBinding` manifests in the GitOps repository to verify permissions are granted based on roles, not individual users.
**Examine:** Review the branch protection rules in the Git repository to ensure merges to the main branch require peer review.
**Test:** Log in as a user with limited permissions and attempt an administrative action. Verify the action is denied with a 'Forbidden' error.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-2.8: Auditable Events
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the audit logging configuration and integration with a SIEM.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `oc get apiserver cluster -o yaml` to ensure the audit profile is `Default` or stricter. Examine the configuration of the log forwarding agent.
**Test:** Perform an action in the cluster and search the SIEM for the corresponding event, verifying all required fields are present.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-3.4 & RE(1,2): Software and Information Integrity
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the use of the File Integrity Operator.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `oc get fileintegrity` to verify the File Integrity Operator is deployed and configured to monitor critical host paths.

**Test:** SSH to a node and modify a monitored file (e.g., `/etc/hostname`). Wait for the next scan and verify that a `FileIntegrityNodeStatus` object reports a failure and an alert is generated in the SIEM.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-4.3: Use of Cryptography (FIPS)
assessment-activities.description: Assesses if FIPS mode is enabled for the cluster.

steps.description: **Test:** Run `oc get clusterversion version -o jsonpath='{.status.conditions[?(@.type=="FIPS")].status}'` and verify the output is `True`.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for SAR-2.4 & RE(1): Mobile Code (Image Policy)
assessment-activities.description: Assesses enforcement of trusted container image policies.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review `ImageContentSourcePolicy` and admission controller policy manifests in the GitOps repository.
**Test:** Attempt to deploy a pod with an image from an untrusted registry and verify the admission controller blocks it.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-5.1: Network Segmentation
assessment-activities.description: Assesses the implementation of network policies.

steps.description: **Examine:** Review `NetworkPolicy` manifests in the GitOps repository, looking for a default-deny policy in critical namespaces.
**Test:** Deploy a test pod in a default-deny namespace. Attempt to connect to another service and verify the connection times out.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment for CR-7.2: Resource Management
assessment-activities.description: Assesses resource limits for critical system components.

steps.description: **Examine:** Run `oc get pods -n openshift-kube-apiserver -o yaml` and inspect a `kube-apiserver` pod definition. Verify that `.spec.resources.requests` and `.spec.resources.limits` are set for CPU and memory.

assessment-activities.title: Assessment of Compensating Controls
assessment-activities.description: Assesses compensating controls for requirements not met by the software.

steps.description: **Interview:** Interview the data center manager to discuss physical security measures (cages, surveillance).
**Interview:** Interview an infrastructure engineer to confirm UEFI Secure Boot is enabled in the BIOS for all cluster nodes.
**Test:** Conduct a controlled test of the data center's UPS and generator systems.
